event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error was detected within a XB chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A fatal internal error detected within a XB chip.

The type of fatal error can be determined from the resource affected by the fatal error.
There are three types of fatal errors:


   Faults in the common logic of the XB chip or the part of the XB chip that interfaces to another XB chip:
       
      Entire platform will be reset.

         If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
         then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

         If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
         then the platform will be powered down.


   Faults in part of the XB chip that interfaces to a SC chip:

      Reset of all the domains on the CMU that the SC chip resides on will occur.
      The CMU and all its associated IO are deconfigured.


   Faults in part of the XB chip that interfaces with an IOC:

      A system operating with both crossbar ways enabled would result in a
      single domain being reset and the relevant IO Channel (1/2 an IOC)
      being deconfigured after the reset operation is performed.

      A system operating with a deconfigured crossbar way would result in the
      domains using the IOC chip being reset and the entire IOC being
      deconfigured after the reset operation is performed.

   
         IO Channel 0 on IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI Express slots 0 and 1 on this IOU.

         IO Channel 1 on IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI Express slots 2 and 3 on this IOU.

         IO Channel 2 on IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI Express slots 4 and 5 on this IOU.

         IO Channel 3 on IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI Express slots 6 and 7 on this IOU.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU's.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:31:10 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: 6324a996-5341-4875-960b-dd262e79aab5
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8006-FP for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8006-FP, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:31:10 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 6324a996-5341-4875-960b-dd262e79aab5
   DESC: A fatal error was detected within a XB chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8006-FP for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Depending upon which part of the XB chip is faulty, either a crossbar way is deconfigured,
   or a CMU and all its associated IO are deconfigured, or an IOC chip is deconfigured,
   or an IO Channel within an IOC chip is deconfigured. Please consult the detail section of the
   knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: Depending upon which part of the XB chip is faulty, either the entire platform is
   reset, or one or more domains are reset. If the response includes deconfiguring a crossbar
   way and this is the first crossbar way to be deconfigured, the platform will operate
   with reduced performance. If the response includes deconfiguring a crossbar way
   and a crossbar way has already been deconfigured, the platform is powered down.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
   

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 6324a996-5341-4875-960b-dd262e79aab5

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 15:31:10.7928 6324a996-5341-4875-960b-dd262e79aab5 SCF-8006-FP
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.xb.fe

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/xbu=0/xb=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/xbu=0/xb=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                             server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0639L444:
                             part=CA06620-D301 A6:revision=0201/component=/XBU_B#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.


If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Depending upon which part of the XB chip is faulty, either the entire platform is reset, or one or more domains are reset. If the response includes deconfiguring a crossbar way and this is the first crossbar way to be deconfigured, the platform will operate with reduced performance. If the response includes deconfiguring a crossbar way and a crossbar way has already been deconfigured, the platform is powered down. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Depending upon which part of the XB chip is faulty, either a crossbar way is deconfigured, or a CMU and all its associated IO are deconfigured, or an IOC chip is deconfigured, or an IO Channel within an IOC chip is deconfigured. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error was detected within a XB chip.
